result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvtavis Walter Pugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $1699.09 to Morgan H joint and several with 15CF2275.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1699.09 to Morgan H joint and several with 15CF2275.
Pay DNA surcharges
Pay all applicable court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
**04-21-16/Order amending JOC to reflect 224 days of sentence credit in case 15CF1374 and 0 days of credit on case 15CF2276.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full-time employment.
Obtain a GED/HSED.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Court ordered defendant provide DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions. Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Per order dated 04-21-16/JOC amended to reflect 224 days of sentence credit in case 15CF1374 and 0 days of credit on case 15CF2276.
Order Amending Judgments of Conviciton, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. spc
Letter from DOC regarding sentence credit.

Per Order signed on 1/6/2015:  correct to show defendant sentenced to a  Total of eight (8) years,  credit of 228 days.  Consecutive to any other sentence.   Initial Term of Confinement of five (5) years and Extended Supervision of three (3) years.  Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has satisfied victim notification.   PSI reviewed and corrections made.  
On Court's motion defendant's first name is amended to Marvtavis and defendant's correct date of birth is 01-16-1997.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to 15CF1545; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- Absolute sobriety
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- Court ordered defendant provide DNA sample
- Court orders no other specific programming conditions. Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1699.09 to Morgan H joint and several with 15CF2275.
Pay DNA surcharges
Pay all applicable court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief      
Victim Impact Statements
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 11-05-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in court with Attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Defendant Martavis Walter Pugh in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Court orders a presentence investigation.  Order received and filed.  Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Scott Douglas Connors in court, defendant Martavis Walter Pugh not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea hearing,however defense has retained new counsel.  Atty Connors requests more time.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices in court, defendant Martavis Walter Pugh not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter for Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for global resolution only.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Judge Donald approves this case to be transferred to Judge Witkowiak's Court for purposes of a global resolution.

Defendant Mavrtavis Walter Pugh in court with attorney Robert Meyeroff for Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Mavrtavis Walter Pugh in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Morgan H.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.     DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.    The court ordered no possession of drugs without a valid prescription and no drug paraphernalia.  Court orders DNA sample to be obtained by Sheriff's Department

Defendant Mavrtavis Walter Pugh in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge *, Branch *.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES  QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-29-2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
